kCdkzm8b-q0HaYo9k-0mfA.text: Tried the new location for Midwood tonight. It was opening night and the food was awesome! Lives up to the original Midwood standard and all the staff were very attentive. Brisket is great, collards are perfect, and mac n cheese is ridiculous. Management also gave us a piece of the pecan cobbler on the house. I'd never tried it before but I'm so glad they laid it on the table. My wife and I destroyed it. Thank you!

TCTfEfY6djO789Uk0GjviA.text: This was our first time and we absolutely loved it. I just had a salad that I was able to make myself and it was delicious. I would highly recommend it and I can't wait to go again. I didn't care for the hush puppies but u don't really need them because everything else is so good

Qsja9lkZS_Wgaj3ra886LA.text: The central location has always been good so decided to try this one.  Smoked salmon is usually good at smoke houses...  just ok, nothing special.  Stuffed bacon wrapped jalapenos - 2 out of 3 not stuffed.  Told by server that side salad could be substituted for a side.  Was unexpectedly up charged.  Also side salad had corn and black beans tossed into salad, no option to remove because of staff tossing salad for you..  top it off with having told the server that I didn't care for the salad and receiving an "oh".  Later questioned up charge and received a "would you like a refill to go?"  It was as if I hadn't said anything.  Only refill given was the one to go...   at central location managers come by to ask how your meal was, the two men who appeared to be managers stood over by bar talking.  May have ruined my support for Millwood in future...

iNZ0B22ezhgMS4CBbPPrGw.text: The food was as good as the original restaurant on Central. I had the BBQ (burnt ends) with hush puppies, collard greens, and sweet potato fries. Our waitress was helpful to explain the different BBQ sauces. My wife had a salad, and macaroni and cheese (and shared some of my sides). There was also a good selection of draft beer. There was an issue with the taste of her salad, and our waitress changed it out to a regular salad. The manager came over twice to ask if we needed anything, and he wanted to make sure we were okay. Great service; makes you feel taken cared of! We enjoyed our visit, and will return.

sViVBYvUx5mbaPW3J2patg.text: Just had the Carolina pork with greens and was not disappointed. Look forward to our next visit

lI9yJIAylsfhxYfTzXvnYg.text: This restaurant is amazing!  Worth the wait. We tried the pulled pork, chicken, ribs and burnt ends. Sides were excellent too!! Can't wait to go back and try dessert as we ran out of room. :)

OeVmONkimhW1tskYB0Oc0g.text: Good food very good service. . The restaurant was busy but we were able to take are time and injoy are meal with out being rushed

zchYLykpyK_D4rE0iOSByg.text: I know they JUST opened like yesterday, and I know they just literally got their liquor license today before they opened, but this was a meh experience. I ordered a Moscow Mule and there's no way there was any alcohol in it. I watched the bartender search for a pour spout, not find one, leave the unopened bottle at the end of the bar, pull down two more brand new unopened bottles of vodka and just leave them. I didn't watch the actual preparation of my drink but I definitely didn't taste the alcohol and all three bottles of vodka remained unopened, without pour spouts, and were clearly full bottles. I was also half way done with my entree before the second half of my companion's meal appeared. Guess the kitchen forgot? Pros though are that it's spacious and has a good layout, my food and half of my companion's appeared quickly, food was good, and their SC mustard sauce is pretty good, coming from a SC girl. I realize new openings and probably new staff come with hiccups, and this is right by me so of course I'll be back, next time I'll say something about my $9 cocktail though.

NEMLCdXRlpRzesCxeqMtHA.text: We enjoyed a wonderful dinner at the Midwood Smokehouse behind Park Road Shopping Center tonight. Even though we had to wait for a table, the service was very good and food was great. We split the 4 meat combo "well-fed" and still had to get a to go box.  The management and staff were attentive. They made sure everything was right. We will definitely return to this location. In my opinion, the best of the 3 Midwood locations I have eaten at.

IuUM3qmEJsoOGI_IJlUFEA.text: Fantastic BBQ and service! We were in from out of town and looking for a good place to eat. We chose Midwood based upon other reviews and were not disappointed. The smoked salmon was cooked to perfection and the smoked meats were extra smoky - deliciously infused with hickory. The collard greens are a must too!  Be sure to say hi to EC too!

JYiDBCT-bsCKOoZVV6AlWQ.text: Sunday I ate at the newest Midwood Smokehouse which had just opened a few days prior behind Park Rd Shopping Center. I am no stranger to this restaurant usually eating at the Plaza Midwood location. I usually get a BBQ plate but opted for a sandwich and fries this time. First of all, this particular location is way nicer than the PM location but each fit the area and clientele they cater to. They weren't very crowded so we were seated right away. Service was excellent but the best part was the BBQ sandwich. Mouth watering delicious!! My only little issue is with the fries. I love the mini crinkle-cut fries but they don't brown them enough. They were limp. I noticed the PM location was the same with their fries too. This wasn't always the case. Back when they first opened, the fries were cooked to perfection. Then suddenly, they decided that crispy fries weren't as important. This won't keep me from returning but I will opt for a different side now instead of the limp fries.

K9tPPpgMqDhMydc6cCyehg.text: Midwood Smokehouse is one of the newest additions to the Backlot of the Park Road Shopping Center and that is a yippee for me, as I live in the area.  Having been to other Midwood locations I was definitely looking forward to checking out their newest spot.  The weather was nice so we opted for waiting for a table on the outside patio, which was less than 10 minutes.  While we waited we ordered some drinks at the bar, and eyed every dish that went by, as well as smelled the amazing goodness. After arriving to our table we were greeted by our waitress who was great! She had a smile on her face and definitely gave us and every table around us the attention customers deserve. We decided to order a Combination Platter, which comes with 4 meats and two sides, and added a few additional sides. From the platter selections we chose the Chopped Pork, Brisket, St. Louis Style Pork Ribs and the Hickory Smoked Sausage with Macaroni & Cheese, Smoked Veggies, Crinkle Fries and an extra side of Hushpuppies. The food arrived and boy did it look good. By far the chopped pork and brisket were the winners, with the hushpuppies and fries shining for the sides.   Dinner did not disappoint and overall I think Midwood will be a definite hit in this location. With the service, atmosphere and food as good as it is anyone should check it.  And, go hungry, it's a lot of food!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Combo Platter with Chopped Pork, St.Louis Style Pork Ribs, Beef Brisket, Hickory Smoked Sausage and a side of Macaroni &amp; Cheese and Fries
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hush puppies!

z4ShaGcNFSmpx2LvNbbRCA.text: Enjoyed a great time with my coworkers! First time here, will definitely be back! I had the queso with brisket and pulled pork sandwich

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

MuljEq6wYAl4UyX_NrZnOA.text: The brisket is amazing! You have to try their queso with brisket. I get this delivered all the time. The chips are perfect with the dip. I've also had the brisket burnt ends which were to die for. This is a must go for bbq!!!

KMmODx3RMu7p-0Ses2XNEg.text: Amazing combo platter. I got some crispy St Louis style ribs which were amazing. Burnt tips , the brisket which was one of the best I've ever had and the pulled pork. Really good food here I am satisfied and didn't even finish half.

N5KnTx1JwFiwmJu6vlMPgw.text: Was pretty good! Got the bbq chicken sandwich on doordash, can't complain. Good sized portion. A little dry though

nRDG-h3YV8SfJ5vXBIr1ug.text: Finally a BBQ restaurant so good that it deserves five stars. Of course it has to be in Charlotte NC.  I say that because right now I live in Salt Lake City and they struggle when it comes to good BBQ.  Those in Salt Lake City trying to build a restaurant and try to sell BBQ need to get out and go to the BBQ regions this country has to offer before attempting to sell their version of BBQ. While visiting Charlotte, NC with my wife while she had a layover, the main thing I wanted to do was spend a nice day with my her and have authentic BBQ. I searched on Yelp and came across a number of BBQ joints and the one with the most ratings was Midwood Smokehouse. I asked a couple of locals and we were assured that we couldn't go wrong here. The Midwood on Brandywine is one of four restaurant that they own and closest to our hotel. I like that the restaurant didn't go for the BBQ dive look like most do and although it is a newer restaurant it was very clean. Our server was very nice and helpful. I want to try a local beer and she gave me a few samples to try and I went with the Sugar Creek Pale Ale. Slightly sweet and yeasty flavor but doesn't over power the taste of the food your inhaling.  As for the food we decided to share a platter where you pick four proteins. Now my wife isn't a big fan of BBQ but she does like brisket so she let me pick; we had chopped pork, brisket, St. Louis style ribs and my favorite.. burnt ends.  The platter arrived in a nice presentation with hush puppies, a dollop of coleslaw along with our sides of baked beans and Mac n' cheese. My wife tried a burnt in and asked me what it was so I explained the process of making a burnt end and she it was incredible. I have had many burnt ends over the years but these were incredible. I like how Midwood sauces them and caramelizes them at the end. I had no complaints with anything that that I ate. Hickory is one of my favorite woods to smoke with and I like that it gives such great color and if you do it like these guys you get a nice light smokiness to the meat. Our next favorite was the brisket and then ribs and chopped pork. When she came up for air my wife said it was so good the food didn't need BBQ sauce and she was right but the sauces are good too, just not necessary.  So when it comes to BBQ Midwood is the real deal. I'm looking forward to returning to Charlotte and go to their first restaurant.

R-4fomcGG9S6PHn5ImnC_g.text: Had the smoked wings and salad with beef brisket plus a local white ale.  Everything was really good and I will definitely be back next time I'm in town

ybJvo7hjm27YYpjYLgtitA.text: I was traveling in Charlotte for work and decided to get some Carolina BBQ. I found this place and wow it was great. I had the burnt ends ( always my favorite) and the were fantastic. With Mac and cheese and greens . The service was great. Even the host who sat me was funny and friendly. My server was attentive but not overly. My drink was her suggestion and was wonderful. I took the pecan cobbler back to my hotel for a late night snack and it was the best I had ever had , my only complaint was that my to go cobbler didn't have utensils which made it challenging in the hotel . Eat here!!! I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burnt ends w Mac and cheese and greens

yxvphlFz16t1-9UH5ZOm6g.text: Mac and cheese was really good, probably in the top 5 I've ever had but the chicken wings were extremely tough. I think they should stovetop cook them first then grill or smoke them. They were pink and it was very hard to get the meat off the bone.

6hQVIv4JCTrK_72jDVVszg.text: Great BBQ, friendly wait staff, and a good bourbon selection. I will definitely be back!

D0mRbMzwrA-wZMY1oWlkUQ.text: Best bbq in town! I don't know which I love more, the meat or the sides. My only recommendation is more "light" sides as when I leave I always feel like I've gained 10 pounds!

FtxYkWr9yUNC7Unkq3VyCg.text: I am definitely a fan of the Mid Wood Smokehouse. I regularly go to the Plaza Midwood location but this location is closer to my house and I was overjoyed to get some smokehouse a little closer to home.   A good friend of mine told me the Smokehouse had opened and I sprinted over... I am not sure if this location has recently opened or if they're smoker just wasn't up to par completely yet... but something was definitely different about this experience.   Don't get me wrong- the service was amazing as usual, the decor was local and lively... everything was basically great... except the Beef Brisket... now I am a beef girl and I like my beef brisket to have some fat and some char on it. But these particular slices of brisket were so smoky in flavor - my mouth literally tasted like I had ash inside my mouth. Again - don't get me wrong... the meat was tender and even juicy in spaces.. but the overwhelming char, fire, smoke taste over powered my ability to enjoy this meal.   I'm convinced this experience was some type of insane weird flawed evening - so I will return and update my review with hopefully better news about the smokehouse brisket.   Now - as for the other sides.... awesome and amazing... per my usual - mach and cheese and the hush puppies that created my love for hush puppies were amazing.

TybMVaFhtvNOAukS2-7dyQ.text: Ok y'all know I have a slight BBQ problem... like I have no problem eating too much. Business travel happened to have found me in the Charlotte area and I knew it was time to get my meat sweats goin' on!  I checked around and this place had great reviews and was kinda tucked away. I headed over there, easily found parking, and waddled up to the front desk. A young sweetheart greeted me and said it was fine to have a seat at the bar, which I did. The barkeep was a very nice young fella who greeted me straightaway with a menu and a glass of water. I mean seriously, how's that for southern hospitality? I asked for a cocktail and a dinner suggestion, both of which he kindly obliged with solid suggestions. I took his advice and was soon met with a cold drink and a plate of hot food. Super fast, but after all, barbecue has been cooking for hours, it doesn't take long to whip up a plate. They have two kinds of sauce: tomato-based barbecue sauce, and that vinegar-based stuff some folks like. I had the brisket and sausage combo with mixed coleslaw and hush puppies (although I didn't eat the hush puppies because I'm living the low carb life... well I had one-half of one and it was damn good son!). Anyway it was a good, solid meal with nice conversation, which is just what the doctor ordered for a long day on the road.  If you're in the Charlotte vicinity, hit this place. You'll thank me later.

BNGT8YR6J48uYRVEkZD6ww.text: Best barbecue I've ever had. Brisket is to die for, all the sides are excellent, reasonably priced and the staff are so nice. I'll be returning next time I'm in Charlotte

S39hHBxNnl57uWP7B-6mjA.text: We ate here for my fiance's birthday dinner. He loves barbeque and I wanted to come to this location instead of the original in Plaza Midwood so that our family and friends joining us wouldn't have such a dreadful parking experience. The parking lot was actually pretty busy, but it was restaurant week so I'm sure that contributed to it.   The service we received when I called to make our reservation was absolutely above and beyond. Normally you call a restaurant they ask for how many people are attending and what time and that's it. Midwood Smokehouse asked if we would like to use their private dining room for the birthday gathering, if we had any and all accommodations for elders, babies,  allergies, and if we would be bringing a birthday cake.   The services we received when we arrived matched the host to a T. They were so attentive with every question we asked and the services that we needed.   Of course, I cannot leave out the best part, the FOOD! I ordered the brisket and when the waiter put my food down in front of me I asked if I could have a knife and different waitress said "Oh you shouldn't need a knife and if you do our kitchen staff will be fired." SHE WAS RIGHT! The brisket was so tender and beyond delicious. I had the hush puppies and baked beans, they were both absolutely perfect.   We will definitely be back for both the lovely staff and great food.

wWQfL1FvddIA23pWXtQjpA.text: Took a day trip up to Charlotte from Myrtle Beach and stopped here. We ordered wings and the loaded fries with brisket for appetizers. We tried all the sauces loved the sweet habernero one. Then my friend ordered the rib/chicken combo with his puppies and macaroni and I ordered the brisket sandwich on Texas toast with collard greens. Oh lawwdd! When I say the food was delicious...we had our server bring the cook out! So good and I wrapped it up with banana pudding which was amazing! This is going to be my go to place when in North Carolina. I really was that awesome!

Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

l1yKplogj8zHvEMBdJcmaw.text: I ate at this location today with a friend. Previously I had only been to the Midwood location years ago & the menu at that time was a more traditional barbecue restaurant. Today I was blown away with all the new items!! I must confess I don't eat beef or pork so I expected to have limited choices but I was delighted to see salmon, tacos, salads with tons of add ons & lots of side options. I chose the Midwood grilled which had Cheddar & Gruyere cheese, smoked onions and a creamy tomato spread on Texas Toast. It was the best grilled cheese I have ever had! I loved the added flavor of the onions & the tomato jam and the Texas Toast gave the perfect crispness to stand up to the generous amount of cheese. For a side I chose the side salad which had avocado, black beans, romaine, cheese, etc. with ranch & avocado green goddess dressings on the side. Yummy! When I eat out I really enjoyed having unexpected & unique food combinations and I definitely had that today. I will be coming back to try more!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled cheese with side salad. Both were original &amp; delicious!!

JDrUVU9DrEMXeecnQScMWw.text: Best BBQ I've ever had!! I wish I lived in Charlotte because I would be eating here everyday!  The brisket, mac and cheese and bacon wrapped jalapenos were off the chains delish!  My husband had the chicken and ribs plate so of course I tried the ribs....sooooo damn good! Plus they give different bbq sauce options and my fav was the one with the hint of jalapeno or habanero(I can't remember which pepper hint it was)anyways that was good.  The customer service was amazing! Everyone was very friendly and welcoming. Our waiter was knowledgeable and very attentive.  He even surprised us with banana pudding dessert! That was to die for! I can't wait to visit Midwood again

sdOt80S7-mqr6wkFLjZAgQ.text: We stopped by for dinner on a Tuesday night. There wasn't a wait at all! There is also outside seating but they couldn't let us sit out there at that time. However, the outside seating looks like a place you could definitely bring your dog one day.   They have drink specials as well. They are:  Monday - $3 off signature drinks Tuesday - $3 NC drafts & $2 off cans over 12 oz Wednesday - 20 oz for the price of 16 oz Thursday - 1/2 price bottles of wine Friday - $2 off bourbon Flights  Sunday - $3 off bloody good choices   We ordered the Queso with chopped up brisket. The brisket was very tender but the cheese could use a little more flavor.                      We ordered a large plate which is more than enough food for two people! The Carolina Pork is what we ordered with a side of bacon wrapped jalapeno's and sweet potato fries. It comes with pickled onions and hush puppies which were excellent complements to the dish! This was such a great deal for only $13!   Overall the experience was delicious and had a homey vibe. *Side Note - bring a coat, it was chilly inside!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Queso with brisket
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Large Carolina pork plate with sweet potato fries and bacon wrapped jalapeños.

ZM0yf0EM-VRfdt8G1UxMkw.text: I am used to the Midwood Smokehouse location in Plaza Midwood. I had always been so happy with the meals there. So maybe my expectations were too high going into this park road location. Speaking of location- it's a great location! We had a fantastic server and kind hostess. Good beer. Bad news is... the food was just not good. We did go around 8pm. I just loved their chicken and i was so disappointed because it was very dry. The ribs were not a hot temperature but more Luke warm. The bacon wrapped jalepenos were soggy and the corn pudding needed some salt. Perhaps this was an off night... but I'm willing to try again based off of what I know the plaza Midwood location to be!

Qz1G31nkultgYGNs-BM42A.text: This is my favorite BBQ place on the area! I think some might know me by name now. Bartenders are awesome. Matt is always phenomenal. Always tells us hi when we walk in and havent seen him in a while. The burnt ends are to die for!!! Blue moon is always fresh and COLD.   Will miss this one when I move

d2W2lt6Vf3KpeGPMMkyR5Q.text: Didn't take them long to grab 5 stars from me.  I sat at the bar and was served perfectly.  I ordered a 1/2 rack with sauce on the side.   Both bartenders brought samplers of different sauces which varied in heat and complexity.  Gotta say that habenero sauce was the kicker . . . so good.  The ribs were spot on:  tender, just a slight tug to separate from the bone,  flavorful, and juicy.  Ditto on the collards.  Me like a lot!  Welcome to the neighborhood!

They accidentally gave me baked beans instead of the mac n cheese & when I mentioned it the server apologized & brought me the correct side right away. The sandwich was huge and the creamed corn was amazing!!!

3VKl-3zjUOobrvgwGINfOg.text: We used to live near the Midwood Smokehouse off Central.  They had good food but we didn't frequent this location too much.  We decided to check out the new Midwood in the Backlot of Park Road shopping center.  Man this place is a Gem.  We ordered a bottle of wine (I know weird for a BBQ place) and the bacon wrapped jalapenos and brisket pimento cheese fries.  The food came out quick and was incredible.  The highlight was our server JP.  He always checked up on us and made us feel welcome.  This guy is a professional and gives you service expected from high end restaurants.  Ask for him when you visit.  We will be back.    Ps.  The drink specials are on point (see photos)

YwpHFwIagF56xQbPkO5Ywg.text: Besides getting to visit with our son and his girlfriend, coming to Charlotte and finding new places is something my husband and I love to do.  My son and his girlfriend are savvy when it comes to finding which places we should tryout and see.   Midwood Smokehouse was definitely a winner.  It is located in behind Park Road Shopping Center in a very nice building with an outdoor dining area.   We chose to be seated on the patio.  Our server was welcoming and attentive.  They offer "small plate" that includes one side, hush puppies and pickled onions and "large plate" that gives 2 sides, as well as the hush puppies and pickled onions.   I chose the small plate split 1/2 chicken  Midwood style along with fries and hush puppies.  Husband can never pass up the chance to try ribs.  He said the ribs were very good and he would positively order them again.  The four of us enjoyed our food and the different beverages offered.  My first time here but hopefully not the last.

_bWJw5xUgLfOqi9fBtyY8A.text: I have eaten here many times and I have really enjoyed it but this experience was different. The entree was very good but when we received the dessert the chocolate sauce tasted very sour like spoiled milk. The service was also not the best but still would eat here again when their is different service.

S0iCepaf2PiuwFQZeh3FqQ.text: I ordered Midwood Smokehouse via Door Dash.  My order arrived without one of the entrees and one of the entrees that arrived had a wrong side.  I called the restaurant and spoke with the manager who told me he would make me a salad if I would come to get it then told me the side I wanted for the other entree wasn't available so he took it upon himself to substitute.  Not to mention the food arrived cold.  He was not really interested in the fact that I now do not have dinner for myself and the wrong dinner for my husband.  I will not be ordering from there again.

JlciUOa9YU_TTl5LrFSJPg.text: Love this place! The brisket queso is SO GOOD. However please bring back the pulled BBQ chicken sandwich!

Htveh2lrL50wFBN1N9-u6w.text: Doesn't matter where in the country you are from, and that's including all of those proclaimed bbq capitals of the world, this is as good as it gets!!  Midwood knows smoked meats and absolutely slams side dishes!  Having visited more than this location, I can attest to the fact that they're consistent at any location.  Their smoked wings are just incredible, and without a doubt, are just the best I've ever had anywhere!  The smoked pulled pork and beef brisket or just as tender as can be and so full of flavor that I personally do not even have to add their house made sauce! The beef brisket salad is out of this world, and when combined with their avocado cream dressing, is just heavenly! From their Mack and cheese, to their barbecue baked beans, and their bacon wrapped jalapenos, their sides are a winner no matter what you decide to choose! I have to also add that the staff at this location was just as friendly and helpful as it's been at other locations!  Midwood is the place for smoked meats!

KLM7BKvXPlyKVjn2FnLdGQ.text: Absolutely fantastic! Amazing food that just transforms you to a place of pure pleasure. Great service and wonderful environment!!!!

DwmCmbuZlOTYYJgR4F53jA.text: Amazing meal and service! Yolanda was outstanding, and made the experience wonderful. Being from Texas, I had high expectations for BBQ, and this joint didn't disappoint.

mAdLwCO0sXlN7Chue2fkqA.text: I really like this place. The pulled pork sandwich and brisket is really good. I also like the chicken wings BUT   I would not go here on Friday/Saturday nights.   Due to the place being more crowded, food quality is lower than normal. I ordered the chicken wings and they came out faster than I expected but ended up being really dry, which it normally isn't.   Also, the lower level was full of little kids. It was like they wanted to keep them separate from the other room but not fun for couples that don't have kids.   Almost any other time, good place to go for BBQ.

HhdYZJpq5bw6ZunGhy7Ylg.text: Good BBQ and outstanding service. A bit of a drive from where we were staying, and it's not your typical hole in the wall bbq place. But good food none the less!  Worthwhile stop if you're in the area

QPRiUF9eIJJnEygIvQpV1w.text: So... we bought the Party Pack for 8-10 people for our Father's Day brunch which totaled $81 after tax. The meal that we received will certainly not be enough to feed 8-10 people (more like 4 but certainly not 8 people and no where near 10 people) and was way overpriced. We are disappointed with this purchase and will think long and hard before we purchase any Party Pack from this restaurant again.

gdVTYW1zdlsRnTZG1ye6Yg.text: Absolutely the best BBQ. This is a must do!  The burnt ends were incredible along with their local craft beer. Highly recommend!

PIGbn24TwS-iq9SQEjCJGw.text: I very rarely give out a 5 Star review. Coming from Colorado, our BBQ options are limited. As a NC native, I know what good BBQ is. On our recent trip back to NC, we had it in our plans to find a really good BBQ place and I think we did. While this restaurant may not be approved of by the purists who think good BBQ only comes from a busted old building with linoleum floors, plastic trays and a ceiling fan, it's approved of by me and my family. Nice decor and televisions to watch various sporting events are a bonus. The prices were very competitive. We tried the brisket, pulled pork, ribs, burnt ends and sausage along with sides of bacon wrapped jalapenos, collard greens and hushpuppies. Everything we had was excellent. The brisket and ribs were up there with the best I have ever had. The sausage had killer flavor. The side items were solid, with the collard greens being the best I've hand, bar none. If I lived locally, I'm afraid of how often I would go to Midwood. Thank you for fulfilling our family's goal of getting good, wood smoked BBQ on our trip.

bMQDUQK-UZd8jpQjFw3jwQ.text: Midwood is one of my kids favorite places to eat. My son loves the Mac n cheese and my daughter orders her own custom salad. I was recently there on a week day for lunch and tried one of their special burgers. The burger is called the Ron Burgandy and it literally changed my life. Although I cannot eat something like that regularly, I will eat it when I can. They were nice enough to make it for me last time I was there and it did not disappoint. The burger has pico de Gallo, guacamole, cheese, French fries and their special ground patty. I'm getting hungry just thinking about it. Great place for the whole family.

3GByJKFdkZdV7vL-SSNRhQ.text: This is hands down some of the best BBQ I've ever had. Great smokey flavor and tasty sauces too! We got our food literally 5 minutes after we ordered. Would highly recommend!

v69iPPeLFBwRk4UsB7ReDw.text: Pepper is what's for dinner. So disappointed with the food after raving reviews. But most everything was so chock full of pepper it took away the taste of the dish.  We are also a family who loves heat and well seasoned food so this took us back to experience all this pepper.  The best thing we ate was the pork and beef burnt ends. Also, our server Heidi provided excellent service!  We first started with the nachos added beef brisket - it had way too much bbq sauce. Dinner consisted of - plate of 4 meats combo dinner for my husband and I (beef burnt ends, chopped pork, and double ribs) with 2 sides (mac-n-cheese and collard greens). Burnt ends amazing, chopped pork full of pepper, ribs not tender... the sides were nothing to talk about at all. Our teen boys chose Pork Burnt Ends with cream corn - Burnt ends were wonderful but the cream corn was full of black pepper which takes away the taste of the corn. The other meal was the TX Brisket sandwich - it was more bread than meat.  Maybe our BBQ standards are too high from having some of the best bbq in Kansas City but this was just average at best.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

gnVP6Prs5uEMjPafnViloQ.text: I really enjoy the Smokehouses in Charlotte and Midwood has been my Favorite. I went to get take out the other night and everything was fine except the Mac and Cheese. It was cold and dry like it had been under a warmer too long. I had two orders but I basically threw them out. The wings and Collards were fine. Maybe next visit will be better.

u1xlXibkxIbZ_OB3hELMnQ.text: Placed a to-go order this evening at the Park Road location. We ordered a 1/2 rack of ribs, however mgr comes out to tell us all out so would we like a beef rib instead. He thanked us profusely- now we know why. Charged us $30, twice the price. Shame on us for not questioning the ole bait & switch

UupiNGJF2-SihX0f9oC1mQ.text: The 1930 Cheesesteak is not your ordinary cheesesteak. It was so much more, using brisket as the meat and white cheddar. I might have to come back just for that! The sweet potato fries were on point, as well. The house sauce was a pleasant surprise, as well - I'm not usually a sweet sauce person, but it had just enough tang to win me over. Fun atmosphere, too, and way bigger than it looks from the outside. Might have to chill at the bar, next time.

66Rj104DKIhFQo6dzplitA.text: Pro: The customer service is good here most days.  Con: The food portions differ from other locations and it seems to be overpriced than the other locations.  The reason it grades three stars is the customer service.

UTbN7wMPxiFTPiUKVjKvHw.text: I've come to this new location twice so far as it is closer to my house. The first time was when they first opened the new location and the second time was last week. My friends and I all ordered the burger special, 2 cooked medium and 1 (medium rare). All of our burgers came out VERY well done. I was the only one who complained because I'm not paying that much for a hockey puck. They apologized and remade the burger,  but my poor friends had to drench their burgers in various sauces to make it somewhat palatable. The burger was alright, nothing special 7/10. Their customer service is top notch, but I'm not sure what is going on in the kitchen back there. My friends are now only willing to go back to the original location.

boZBm5aNXe0g3ZbHTe93pQ.text: Still two stars, came back with the wife and I avoided the burnt ends and stuck with the pulled pork.  Once again it was too salty, and even my wife agreed.  Once again I was offered Nana puddin, once again I declined.  Looks like I'll have to get my smoker out to get my Q fix, as this place ain't cutting it.

pXuo5yBR532wn24RWaD4RQ.text: It was a great day to sit outside and have lunch at Midwood Smokehouse. We began with the BBQ Queso with Pork. It was quite tasty and as we finished our app the food arrived promptly. I dined on the Brisket (they give you an option for lean, fatty, or mixed; I had the lean brisket with the Midwood BBQ sauce. The beef was fine and the sauce was a good compliment. The mac and cheese was A+ and worth every calorie. The plates come with hushpuppies, which were fried crisp. We didn't get dessert but it sure was tempting. The indoor atmosphere looked very appealing, the staff was present, and the food was tasty. It definitely worth the stop if you are in the Park Road Shopping Center and looking for some good ole Southern BBQ.

jYV1p6ptOsZuuvkCelcB2g.text: Stopped in for a beer with the boys..We were on our way to Sir Edmund's, saw Midwood and decided to just go there..We sat at the small bar(bout  8 stools)  Would probably be better to sit at a table /booth in the future, bar is right at the entrance and all the to go orders are handled there..Small but very good tap selection. Split a brisket sandwich with my son, tasty but a bit greasy & salty(Brisket is chopped, not sliced) Side of mac N cheese was very good..Looking forward to them coming to my neck of the woods in Birkdale next month..

7NLQhIc-K_h0tr1U7iX-dA.text: Fantastic! Both in quality and quantity of the food. The waiter, I wish I remembered his name, was really nice and really helpful. Nice atmosphere, literally melt in your mouth brisket, and attentive staff mean this place earned all five stars in my book.

GezRDpYrYxQhzHOSEz_dfQ.text: Stopped in for dinner while traveling from Hilton Head.  Great choice for BBQ. We ordered the burnt ends and the pulled pork with collards and coleslaw as sides.  Everything was delicious.  Nice selection of local craft beers on tap.  They also have wine by the bottle.  Service great as well.  Seemed to be loved by the locals. We were near the bar and saw several customers picking up take out.  Recommend if you can enjoy BBQ.

nZb_AfcdMS-Lhfpt9C_m1A.text: The food was amazing. Manager came by several times to check on us. Our server Gary was on point and super accommodating. Highly recommend this new location, it's good and friendly staff

z7TqXTXTZsayM2TUApxzIw.text: So I went here today for my Anniversary and 1st let me state the waitress Molly C was rude. The tried to sit us a little table but my husband is 6"5 and the chairs are to small. We requested a booth and the hosted said they keep the booths open for guest with a party of 8. But when we look over at the booths,  there is guest of 2 sitting in several of the booths. The hostess walks up back up front and tell us we would have to wait until someone get up from the booths closest to the door to be seated, but than changed her mind and seat us in the same booths she told us we could not sit in. After we was seated, I notice the waiter Molly walk over and asked why she put us there and the hostess said I just sat them there, I'm sorry,  "I am still looking for you a big party." So this immediately mad me mad and I knew it was all about the tip. The waitress Molly came and was at 1st rude, it was written all over her face. Later she tried to relax, but kept running to the hostess station, to complain and the hostess kept assuring her that she is sure I big party was going to come in. Molly kept coming to our table to check if we were anything, hoping we were done for she want miss out on a big party if they came in. I asked for a to go box and left her an $11 tip, when our food was only $24, to make her aware that you have to watch how you treat people,  your actions and what you say could have affected your tip and the restaurants business. But I will never go back here again the baked beans was spicy hot, who in they mind serve hot baked beans, I suffer from a medical condition and cannot have spicy food. The cream corn was the only thing edible. The mac and cheese had a cheap taste, and why bring out a handful of onions with hush puppies?  Who in their right mind just going to eat raw sliced onions? The smoked chicken was dry and you could not pull it apart. I was expected garlic bread, but got sour dough toasted bread. Word for the owners please reconsider your ingredients for dishes, you don't know who could have a health condition or could be allergic to something and the waitress is not warning the food is spicy or have onions in it. They can never get my business again, besides feeling discriminated against the food was nasty.

IrmyimkmEoFdHiOi0W1jDw.text: Tonight was our first visit to Midwood Smokehouse, and we will definitely be back. In addition to the menu items and specials, they were offering "add-ons" so we were able to try additional meats with our meals. The crispy St Louis ribs were our favorite, but the stockyard tacos, burnt brisket ends, burnt pork ends, sausage, mac & cheese, and creamy coleslaw were all delicious. Our server, Bridgett, was wonderful, and all the staff were attentive and helpful. My only regret is that none of the food was actually HOT when it was served, but it was still very tasty. That's the reason for only 4 stars; otherwise, it would be 5.

d65Ev6w7cEfsJLNFFhiLVQ.text: Excellent barbecue, and a great place.  Had the pork, collards, baked beans, and hush puppies.  All of those were among the best I've had, and that comes from tasting great barbecue in Texas, St. Louis, Cincinnati, Memphis, and Kansas City.  Collards were exceptionally good, and pepper sauce added a little kick.  All by the recommendation of the server, Liz, who was as sweet as could be.  Atmosphere in the place was also notable, with all-American decor and classic and new rock hits playing over the speakers.  Overall, an outstanding place to spend a lunch or dinner.

oU-WCNTfJHUaIJKPhOYx_Q.text: Fantastic beers and BBQ here with excellent service. Having come from Pasadena CA, we expected a lot and they delivered here.

qfWqCISBSq2y9z706a9kZA.text: Ok, so when the guys at the Westin, the Uber driver, AND the guys at the guitar store all agree a place is good you can generally take it to the bank. I was not disappointed.  I didn't have a reservation but just walked up at 6pm on Sat night which is risky but the host was very gracious to offer a spot at the bar where I could stash my bulky guitar case from my unexpected purchase (it happens) and still keep an eye on it.  Sat next to a guy who was from upstate NC who come to Midwood every time he's in town and he recommended the 1/2 chicken with SC mustard sauce. I got the fries and coleslaw as sides and it came with a generous portion of hush puppies. Very tasty!  Fries crisp and coleslaw had the delicious tang of North Carolina. The bartender was very attentive.  I got a good chance to just look around and enjoy the atmosphere being there by myself and I saw a lot of good times, good service and good food. Folks, this is a can't miss place if you are looking for good barbeque. I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Midwood Smokehouse
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

SJUNe_GImYbCoy-an4Bz9Q.text: Amazing!!!  Just want to start off and say this was an amazing experience and BBQ.  In Charlotte one night, I had to pick right or I risked having a bad foodie experience in Charlotte.  I did it!  Sydney was our waitress and she was awesome!  Super friendly and took the time to educate my coworker and myself on North Carolina BBQ.  We even met Jenn, one of the managers there who was kind enough to show us the Smoker and explained how all the magic works.  That was awesome!   Lastly, I ordered the following: Carolina Shredded Pork & BBQ Chicken, Brisket, and St. Louis Style ribs, ALL were fantastic and my coworker and I would definitely order ALL of them again.  A must have, is there creamed corn, so good!  Midwood Smokehouse is right up there with ALL the GREAT BBQ smokehouses in the country!! I recommend making Midwood Smokehouse a destination when you are in Charlotte!

ha7NE4xUIEzh2K6NrklT5Q.text: I went for the second time yesterday.  Great BBQ.  The creamed corn brought back memories from my childhood.  So good.  The banana pudding was awesome too.  I will definitely be back.

UeeM5dIUf7xlovX6rI8YtA.text: Was in the South Park area and looked on yelp of a BBQ place to eat at. Saw this place was new and decided to try it.  And it was delicious! Staff greets you right away when you walk in. We got the queso brisket small dish and it came out and we thought it was a large dish. It was a very good choice to get that cause it was very delicious. My girlfriend got the brisket small plate  and it came with hush puppies and pickled onions with a side door of mac and cheese and they ask if you want fat, lean, or both for the brisket. The mac and cheese was very cheesy. I got the 1/2 chicken and it also came with hush puppies and the pickled onions and I received two sides with my plate. I ordered the BBQ baked beans and jalapeno wrapped bacon and they were very delicious. I could've ate a whole plate of them. The waitress we had was very friendly and asked a couple of times how we were doing. If it's a nice day make sure to ask to sit outside. They do run the ac a little low so it does get cold inside.  The patio is a very big area. The BBQ sauce was okay for me. There ice is the best! It's the little chunks that last long. It was to sweet for me but my girlfriend loved it. They have 2 other locations. If your around for BBQ this a place to go!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. The nice patio to sit out and enjoy.
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brisket with hush puppies and mac and cheese
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/2lb chicken with hush puppies jalapeño bacon wrapped and BBQ baked beans.

J9wRFkn0fcHvkVqGesa-BQ.text: Best barbecue in Charlotte, by far! The Carolina barbecue is to die for. They have wonderful sides also, the bacon wrapped jalapenos dipped in ranch are unbelievable. The service here is pretty good, nothing to rant about, but not much to compliment either. My sister does not eat pork and their are always chicken options available. Overall a good place, it is is the barbecue that make it worthy of five stars.

f8zSWg8XVnN_177WiRAP7g.text: I'm an amateur smoker myself, and I'm doing my own experiments with my Weber Smokey mountain, but I tell you this is just another ball game. Just arrived from Charlottesville from tasting bbq and this was just so much better. It's been the best bbq I've ever had, but I'm no expert. The hickory sausage is amazing with a sauce inside which explodes in your mouth with all the flavour. The brisket has an out of the ball park Smokey flavour that without any sauce takes you to the forest and back. The ribs are not melting deboning them so they have still some grip to them and finally the pulled chicken reminds me a bit of the Peruvian recipe and is delicious, maybe lacks a bit of smokiness flavour. The decor is nice, with TVs with sports and a nice bar. This is now my excellence standard for bbq. Also got the chance to visit the kitchen and talk to the pit master, incredible artisan!!! And great guy. I'll be back. All for 28$ with unlimited refills of coke and 2 side orders. A joke.

muwLrG_tqaCSzXfyT4IaEQ.text: Normally we love Midwood! We usually frequent the Birkdalw location, however we decided to try this location last week.   The food; was over cooked, small (in comparison to the meat we normally receive), and it just wasn't Midwood quality that we had grown to love.   We ordered the Well-Fed, where you can pick 4 proteins. For the $30+ we paid for the meat, we received a small amount, that could barely feed one person. And again, it was over cooked! We are disappointed, and it did not reflect the high esteem we held for this brand.

AyNG_TThJ2JiMrNSYj_B0Q.text: Ordered takeout from Midwood Smokehouse using Doordash. Here's a breakdown of what was done:  *Small Carolina Pork BBQ plate. It comes with one side(I got Mac and cheese!) and hush puppies-$11.75  *A side of collards greens( Yes!)-$4.00  *Small BBQ Queso-$4.75  *Banana pudding-$3.00  The Carolina BBQ plate was impressive. The small is really large so very happy about it. The BBQ pork is Carolina style with a vinegar based sauce hence the name. Mac and cheese is decent but not earth shattering. My biggest thing is that the smokiness in the meat was a bit overwhelming at times. I'll attempt I dont have a doctorate in BBQing. It's probably just a personal preference but the meat was very smokey. Not that it was a bad meal,the contrary.  I love love love the collards greens. I'm a southern girl and I know my collards. They have vinegar and pork in them! Very yummy if that's how you take your greens.  BBQ queso was different. In a good way. The flavors between the smokey meat and cheddar are complimentary. Comes with tortillas.  Get the banana pudding!! That's all I have to say about the banana pudding.  In conclusion, the food is really nice. I didn't dine in so I can't speak on the service. I'll probably return but wouldn't go out of my way to do so.

Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Small Carolina pork BBQ with Mac and chees ,added side of collards greens.
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ Beef Queso. Cheese heaven!

aoS2vaiY8sGxY2Vye90_ew.text: So I am definitely one that seeks out authentic bbq in any southern city I visit for work or play. I happened to be in Charlotte for work and knew I had to stop by one of the Midwood locations. They are a brisket house by far, meaning they are a Texas style bbq.  I ordered the four meat combination platter to try everything. I selected the brisket, chopped pork, pulled chicken, and the pork ribs. By far the brisket was the best of the bunch, even though everything was quite tasty. The brisket was melt in your mouth. I selected half lean and half fatty for the brisket. Paired with Mac n cheese and cole slaw, I enjoyed every bite! Come hungry! Definitely will make another trip here.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Four meat combo platter
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bar area
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dining area

olpHtDMTwghjGon-u8JZuw.text: Oh Midwood, how I love thee. This was the first place my husband and I ate in Charlotte when we decided to move here a few months ago. We had sat at the bar, ordered way too much food, and left happy and stuffed. We ended up moving very close by, so now it's a place we've been visiting about once a week. The staff is so friendly here and the service is great. Whether you sit at the bar, in the dining room, or on the nice patio, it's a relaxing place to have a meal.   We love their nachos with brisket on top, and also the cheese fries with brisket on top. Really, just give me brisket on top of anything and I'm good to go. We often split the pork plate. The pork melts in your mouth and has great flavor, and they also have a lot of great BBQ sauces to put on it. I love their hushpuppies, which are always fresh, and we're also big fans of the mac and cheese, collard greens, and baked beans. The pork plate is so huge we often have leftovers that we heat up with breakfast the next morning, and it's just as good. In general their portions are very large for the price. We always have leftovers, even when we try not to order too much.   Midwood also does take out really well. We ordered their smoked wings, a brisket quesadilla, and pork plate to go, and it was all packed so nicely. The brisket quesadilla is so, so good, so I'd highly recommend that whether you want it as a meal or need a snack to share.   Their banana pudding is also delicious, and they have a lot of great beers on tap including a "big size" that my husband beelines for whenever we dine in. They also have great cocktails, which I really didn't expect. I recently had a bourbon/mint/thyme drink that was delicious. There's so many other delicious things on the menu that we have to come back for, especially the ribs. If you're looking for a casual but nice dining experience and great BBQ, check out Midwood.

ulSSu_daFzaLe7Yp40xp3g.text: This was our first stop in Charlotte, wanted to get a taste of authentic BBQ. The place was really nice, quiet, and we were seated quickly. The waitress was friendly and the food and drinks were decent. Husband had the Hot Mess Burger (he said it was awesome) and I had the burnt ends with mac n' cheese and hush puppies. I wish I got the brisket instead, as my plate was just alright - hush puppies were super dry, mac n cheese was room temp, plus the appetizer queso dip also came out room temp (a dish I really expect to burn my tongue on). But maybe that's just how things are here. Overall, we ate and were satisfied and got an awesome albeit pricey t-shirt out of it (the "Praise the Lard" shirt). If we ever visit Charlotte again I could come back to try something else or visit a different branch.

Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burnt ends, hush puppies, man n&#39; cheese

56O2tOLAgDc2h10aXlwQ-A.text: Super busy parking lot behind Park Road Plaza!  Party of 8 and and we got the large private room. They placed Cartoons on the TV for the kiddo and you can upgrade your beer for $1!  This place was amazing.  Awesome customer service!   Brisket 1/2 lean 1/2 fatty- and it was glistening! I did not want to switch or share it with my husband. Next time I want all lean but my husbands prefers it 50/50. ( this is also his goto dish)   Burnt tips cooked with cheerwine- it Friday's special and it was good too. Not as fatty as I expected and its better then I believed.   Kiddos- ordered cheese dip and chips. No one enjoyed the dip but the chips were enjoyed by the kids.    Mac and cheese- kids did not like it but husband enjoyed it.   Grilled veggie- cup size for a size order and I wished there were more vegetables available.   Sweet potatoes- were typical   Hushpuppies- crispy on the outside and nice and fluffy on the inside. I had to push them away they were so good!   Pickled onions- came with the meal and I had to order a cup full. I loved these and I can't believe I forgot the onions!

Px8R_MFg0WDAbDK5XNnj7w.text: Update: this place HAS to be a 5. I can't count how many times we've been here now, we love it and it never disappoints!

iVKcxBUwjOfzZO8kWOkkYg.text: Enjoying a lazy Sunday before Sunday night prime time football between Packers & Steelers (28-31). Being a Packer fan i frequent Angry Ale's so decided to try some restaurants in the area.   Original idea was to visit another spot but how can you see BBQ and not want some.  The service was great, food was great and everyone was very personable and attentive. We were talked into trying the Massive Beef Ribs and when i say it's Massive that is an understatement. The beef basically melted right off the bone and cooked to perfection. Also had the lean Beef Brisket with Mac & Cheese which was also excellent. I'll definitely be getting this again but as a sandwich something about bread and Brisket that just sounds right .   Overall, excellent visit and we'll come back again. Just hopping this wasn't a fluke and the service is 5 Star next time. We arrived around noon so I would be interested to see how it is during the evening hours.

EuL8dmU2LJ4W80koskIX9Q.text: So excited to have this location open. My go to is  the Texas Style brisket sandwich with blue cheese with a side of mac and cheese. I love their brisket!  After my sister in law raved about the 1930 cheese steak (made with their brisket) I had to branch out. It was really good. The american cheesy was melted goodness. But the Texas Style brisket sandwich with blue cheese still remains my favorite. There is just something about the blue cheese with their bbq sauce and the red smoked onions that is just amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Texas Brisket sandwhich with mac and cheese

FGE0AjddA9pckcw5tpTwSQ.text: Dank. (this is a good thing:)  If you're a man like me (or lady) that likes fatty things - while never losing sleep over your waistline - then this restaurant, bar and overall pleasant atmosphere is for you.   I ordered a small plate of the Carolina Pork, macaroni and cheese as my side, and it was bommmmb.   I will return!

6qlZMAtmtIXE1ueVeadJFw.text: Midwood Smokehouse has become one of my husband and I's go-to places in the neighborhood.  Midwood is perfect if you are craving a great barbecue meal, but want something a little nicer than paper plates and napkins, like some places. This location takes online reservations, which is a huge plus, but it's rare we wait too long for a table. Once there, the servers and bartenders are extremely friendly and it has a really great laid back environment. The drinks are also really yummy! The NC Ginger is one of my favorite drinks in town.  As far as food, so far we haven't gone wrong with anything we have ordered. Of course, the pulled pork and brisket are both phenomenal. All of their sauces are delicious too. However, don't sleep on the smoked salmon and smoked chicken! Both were AWESOME! If you are trying to eat something decently healthy, try a salad with the salmon. So good. The smoked 1/2 chicken is a large portion and soo tender. I could never replicate it at home, even in a smoker. As far as sides, I've enjoyed them all. I love the mac n' cheese. Plus, what's a BBQ meal without mac and cheese?   I always leave full, always wish I had room for the banana pudding. I would definitely recommend coming here for a nice, but no frills date night or dinner with friends! Definitely very family friendly as well!

GhAtyCNz8DT0o_r3SSl9bA.text: Some of the best barbecue I've ever had. The "sampler" is more than enough food for two and you will not leave hungry.

xUXKBr9tg5DK4uKq6FZqaw.text: I was in Charlotte for a couple days, and specifically looked up the best bbq in Charlotte, since I'm not often in the South, and I know they're known for good bbq out there... Midwood came up on several lists, and I was glad to find a location not too far from the hotel we were staying at (near the airport). This place is not totally what I expected - I commented to my coworker I was traveling with, when we pulled up, I really thought a place like this would look more like a little hole in the wall. From the outside, this place looks suuuuper corporate and boring, the sort of place you'd expect to phone it in, but they do not do that. Service was friendly and quick from start to finish, and the food, while not cheap, is pretty reasonably priced. I went with the "large" pork burnt ends for $15, and my only complaint is that it's kinda disingenuous to call it "large". I thought I'd leave with left-overs - I did not. I'd call it a "normal" size. It was about one proper serving of food, unless you're a tiny middle-aged woman or just not very hungry ;). That's a pretty small complaint, though - I left solidly full.   The two sides I had - mac & cheese and collard greens - were both good but not exceptional. They are, after all, sides, though - the meat is the star, and their pork was sooooo good. Some of the tastiest pork I've had. Their bbq sauces are also delicious. And I also lucked out and happened to be there on Tuesday, when (I didn't know this until I got there) they also have a special running all day, a full pour of all their local craft beers (they had about 8) for just $3.50 - yes please! They even let me taste a couple first before picking one, which I love at breweries but don't usually see at sit-down restaurants if you're not at the bar, but was very helpful, since the one I ended up loving was not the one I was expecting to.

LlD-cGraQVoY9_fShP4Xmw.text: I had the pleasure of dining here for lunch a year ago while visiting a friend, and I am back again on a short visit and happened upon this same restaurant because of Yelp!  I didn't remember the restaurant until I pulled up in the parking lot on Johnston.  I was instantly giddy because I knew from a year ago the food was great and I was in for a good experience and food I already knew to be tasty! Now the icing on the cake -  we were seated at a table with the same memorable, attentive server with a smile and great menu suggestions.  Walter knows how to sell the menu and shares his favorites.  What we loved - the brisket sandwich, smoked meatballs, burnt ends, tacos, smoked bbq beans, smoked veggies, and it's Friday - the cornbread!  My suggestions - Order any of these and you won't be disappointed, ask for Walter and you'll be glad you did!

j7T1Jsrem-VXWNzp7MSyWA.text: I could leave 0 review management was horrible food too so mean people brisket sucked they cut me off on drinks after bringing 25 people please don't waist your time on that place

lOgEPIXUqEHEBD86bprpwA.text: Terrible!! We just left Midwood as a treat for Father's Day and our experience was terrible. Our waitress was mediocre at best, and the food was horrible. My husband and I split a combo platter...the ribs were so over cooked you couldn't even pull them apart, the shredded pork was cold, and the brisket was all fat. The Mac and cheese had obviously been sitting for quite some time...the cheese on top was hard while the noodles were complete mush. Our waitress seemed to be incredibly inconvenienced by us so it wasn't worth sending any of it back. We absolutely will not be back. Terrible experience and absolutely not worth the money unless you're willing to pay for overpriced food that tastes like 2 day old leftovers.

CRS2dBk1aAy5fPVujs8oBQ.text: We had a wonderful experience here. Staff was expeditious and it was the best ribs I've ever had. We will definitely be back when in the area.

PvmqrnbojpLbbYrM4SSbXw.text: Park Road location patio was a mass of about six screaming children running loose, pulling up plants out of the flower beds, flinging them around. We asked to be moved but there were no other seats available inside. We then asked the parents to get control, but that did not meet with any response except hate stares. The manager said only, "well, it's a family restaurant." The food is good here, but lately the brisket, the "lean" version, is too fatty to eat. Used to be edible. We might visit the Central Ave. location again, but with so many other good choices around town, probably not.

Izqu2M4wt5j4i2FtW6PCxg.text: Was in Charlotte for the coke 600 and what would a weekend there be without BBQ. A hotel employee recommend this restaurant to us and I can tell you we are glad they did. 6 of us enjoyed a lot of meat that evenings the brisket was juicy and rich , burnt ends saucy and  flavourful and smoked chicken and ribs amazing.  We didn't have one complaint about this place.  So if your in Charlotte and want smoked meat check this place out , I don't think you'll be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

FKbwN1J0UniisQu5Lb9ODg.text: Best Brisket in Charlotte in my humble opinion. Melt in your mouth brisket that as writing this review my mouth is salivating.  I have been a few times and to both the original location, ballantyne, and now so excited to have this location in my back yard.   I burnt ends are amazing and will certainly get them again but my go to item here is the TexasStyleBrisket Sandwich. This sandwich is loaded with smoked shredded brisket, smoked red onions, and your choice of of cheese. I get the blue cheese and that to me my friends completes it. Well almost completes it because you need the mid wood sauce ( that of a spicy varietal is my choice) but will also use multiple sauces to  get a different flavor each bite.   Sides you can go with a few different options and yep you know I went with the mac and cheese which is a solid choice for sure.  Another side I would recommend is the hickory smoked bacon wrapped jalapenos with jack cheese. Dip these in ranch and  can you say out of bounds:

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

wR4RIbVBfjfHe0RSC9pUwg.text: My girlfriend and I came here after an 8hr lay over at MLB airport and brought an appetite. We arrived 30 min before closing and were welcomed by Robert (GM) and Mary (waitress). We felt bad for coming in last minute but we were REALLY looking forward on trying this place out after our fellow Lyft driver insisted on trying this place out. Mary was an awesome host for walking us through the menu and offering us her suggestions on the go-to choices and giving us such a welcoming vibe.  We ordered the pimento cheese fries and entree shared the the combo platter (brisket, pulled pork/chicken, and jalapeno cheddar sausage) w/ bbq beans, hush puppies, and bacon wrapped jalapeno poppers. Unfortunately, they were out of the pork ribs and low on brisket because those two are what they're most known for. Luckily we managed to try the remaining brisket and wow. It was nothing I've had back in LA. My favorites were the brisket, bbq beans, and pimento fries. Something about those three just sparked my saliva to just just out uncontrollably..  Matter of fact, everything on our table was remarkable. The mustard and spicy bbq sauce: FIRE.  It could've been because it was our first actual meal of the day but holy fuck. Words can't do the savory deliciousness my taste palate endured. I feel like I'm exaggerating real hard but I'm not.   Towards the end we had the privilege having a talk with Robert about the amount of thought and work he and the crew puts into the restaurant and it compelled me enough to leave this review. Really wish Midwood came to la but it wouldn't be the same. It's True what folk say about North/South Carolina being known for their bbqs cause this place right here left a mark for us. And will definitely hit this place up again. Okay, gonna eat my left overs now lol.

nk-ssIwBtu4v7ZrWC46X6Q.text: Stopped in for an early lunch. Nice place, great soundtrack. Pluses, great staff, hardworking, friendly. Minuses, mediocre BBQ. Got a mixed platter, Pulled pork, Brisket, Sausage, Burnt ends. Strong 5 out of 10 flavor-wise. No smoke ring on the Brisket, over sauced Burnt ends, already sauced pulled pork (vinegar), and the Jalapeno sausage was bland.  Not terrible, but I am sure there is better BBQ in the area, sorry!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

rHU9FUjagR7kBZmSnrOejA.text: Went with friend Peter M.  I had earlier reviewed the Ballantyne location of Midwood, which he read, where I was critical of how crowded and loud that location can be.  Peter suggested that I meet with him over lunch to try his location in south Charlotte.  First, it is a hard place to find.  It is tucked into a shopping area and I do not know Charlotte well, so it took be awhile to find it.  Good news is that there is a large parking lot so it is easy to park.  The dining area is more open and inviting.  There is a step-down level where we ate and had the positive experience of Jennifer as our server.  She was super, taking me through the menu options, which were different from the other Midwood location.  On Peter's recommendation we each had the Hot Mess Hotter Mess.  Was that super great.  It is a chuck & brisket burger patty (Oh, so good!) with creamy bacon jalapeno spread, Monterey Jack & caramelized onions on a bun.  Life does not get much better.  Add the jalapeno poppers for an appetizer and a beer (they have lots of on-tap choices) and you have a meal that is an experience.  Of course, Midwood had the standard array of BBQ ribs, brisket, chicken, sausage, etc.  Those have always been good, regardless of location.  I especially like that they have beef brisket and it is offered fatty, no low fat and in combination.  Nice options.  It seemed that this location had a greater selection of salads and unusual sandwiches such as the Hot Mess that we had.  I might be wrong.  Service was great, conversation with my Yelp! friend Peter M. was interesting and we will most likely try out some other locations together.  Midwood is a solid A-OK.  Worth your visit.

TuNJJlyjNxRlG8zsU6c5IA.text: When I visit this location I order salads.  Last Friday my friend ordered the quesadilla with brisket to share as our appetizer.  It was delicious and amazing!!  No one had ever suggested it in all these years.  I don't know why not because it is soooooo good!  Thank you Leslie for sharing the quesadilla is a new menu item.  All these years, I thought we had all been missing out on this yumminess

c7E_xZrPrzoGBN729vWzCw.text: Still great! I ate here again on a trip to Charlotte and the food was still top notch!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

V8EBHYrWFHdCvpqwxtBE-A.text: This location has a ways to go before matching the original in Plaza Midwood.  I live in the are so was naturally super excited to have this location open close to me.  However, was an underwhelming experience both times I have taken my guests to try North Carolina BBQ.  It was never a problem with service as the staff was always kind and accommodating but the food in my two experiences always came out lukewarm and seemed it was sitting a while before serving.  Also, I have ordered the baked beans each time and it has tasted differently all three times and has been consistently inconsistent.  Also their Carolina vinegar sauce is watery and needs immediate fixes.  I'll probably be back but in no rush.

HrVO6xrA8s-fD45-CYdalA.text: Mehhhhh. So many Charlotte natives love Midwood Smokehouse, but unfortunately I'm not one of them. I ordered the BBQ with a side of baked beans. The hushpuppies were the only thing on the plate that I enjoyed. The BBQ was super dry, and the baked beans were cold. Maybe I caught them on a bad night.   My fiance had the beef rib for $40. It was expensive but he enjoyed it, and this is why I'm awarding 3 stars (based on his experience rather than mine).   Overall, I would give this restaurant another try because so many of my friends like it.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

FKSJFH2BU1AnkI9x01tgiQ.text: The food is always amazing here! Their brisket is one of the best in Charlotte. Their chopped salads and their Philly cheese steak is the best I've had. I've been back many times and will continue to frequent this restaurant.

9J-iyNKUNKJ20U3l06oIIg.text: The atmosphere and the service of this restaurant was pretty good. Although the patio is right in front of the street, there wasn't very much traffic so it was still a very nice place to be. The beef brisket was also phenomenal it had a very evident charcoal flavor to it and the portion size was also very generous. I also wanted to mention the appetizer with jalapeno wrapped in bacon since it was pretty innovative and fun. I would recommend it.

pqs4rGovxo26PAh9tPV_QQ.text: The best BBQ, so far!  I've had BBQ in  Memphis, Texas, Georgia...but, this by far is the best I've had.  Rendezvous in Memphis do not even come close...this place is wonderful! I tried the plate w/a mixture of Pulled pork, ribs, burnt ends, briquet w/hush puppies (best hush puppies I've had) and the cheesiest, macaroni and cheese.  The baked beans had the right amount of sweet and tangy to it...perfect. Our waitress was very friendly, sweet and on top of her game. This whole experience was so fun and positive, will definitely come back, again. Highly recommend this place.

EE7Waz8Gi7Kn9ddKDv_QAQ.text: This restaurant is tucked in on the back side of Park Road Shopping Center.  Tom suggested that we meet there today and it was a great recommendation.  I had the Dixie Salad, which had pulled chicken and avocado and beans and corn and many other tasty ingredients.  I would highly recommend this dish.  They had a lot of other obvious barbecue selections and the typical sides.  I had been to the Ballantyne location many months ago, but much prefer the vibe in this restaurant.  During season, they have a very nice outside dining area.  Hopefully I can return when outside dining is an option.  It was all good today. The price points were decent and the service was excellent.   Not too loud, yet a lively environment.    Hats off to this eatery!

Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

7A8Ts5ejNcrh8C1wT69W9Q.text: I love Midwood Smokehouse. We needed food for a team event today so we decided to get their group take out.   Their party pack for 20-24 people worked really well for us. You get 2 half pans of meat and 2 half pans of sides. We got chicken and pork as our meats (I personally would have done brisket over chicken but we have non-red meat eaters). We got mac and cheese and baked beans as our sides and got an additional half pan of coleslaw. We also added a half pan of banana pudding for dessert.   Almost everything was delicious. The only complaint I heard was about the chicken. People didn't like that they put a mustard sauce on it. I also thought it was kind of dry. The pork and all of the sides were very good. It was a ton of food. We had 20 people and there were a lot of leftovers. I think you could order a size smaller than they recommended.   They also give you slider buns, barbeque sauce, plates, and utensils. Unfortunately, they don't provide any serving utensils which was inconvenient.   The food was ready at the time I ordered it. They were really helpful and helped me carry it all to my car.   I've eaten here many times, but this was my first group take out order. I would definitely recommend both experiences!

Q52i4jXlHGtTwRYwrABFig.text: This was our first restaurant that we went to since vacationing in Charlotte. We went based on reviews on Yelp! Everything was great. Service was good, we were seated fast and food was delicious. Definitely will go back again if we ever come back to Charlotte. Restrooms were also clean.

J40ObypiZvZiJwHKn9rh9A.text: We decided to grab Midwood Smokehouse to-go for friends from Taiwan who wanted some authentic barbecue before going back. We had just come back from Austin, TX so we definitely had high expectations for the brisket! We got one of their combination platters so that we could try a few different meats and sides. Everything was delicious and nothing was too dry which is always my stickler with BBQ. Will definitely be back!

tQS2vTYO_bjaRZo5dP0yXg.text: Best BBQ ever! Tried so many things, can't decide on a favorite. The combination plate is amazing....burnt ends, BBQ Pork and Brisket. Absolutely delish!

cJCUrlqxcmrLbOsDt7oI5w.text: We started our Saturday on a leisurely, lazy pace. We hit Starbucks to start off our day right with various beverages. I parked as we tried to figure out where we wanted to go. One of my friends needed to use the washroom.  After about forty minutes being undecided, I suggested that we have lunch. I had no problem taking a recommendation from my friend's friend. We headed to Midwood Smokehouse.  Getting there was a bit tricky. I missed the odd turn and had to reroute. It's in a plaza that is ridiculously busy. However, when I was closer to the smokehouse, parking was a breeze.  We were immediately seated in a booth. One of my friends had no hesitation in ordering the well-fed combo platter with me. It consists of Carolina chopped pork, beef brisket, St. Louis style pork ribs, hickory smoked sausage, hushpuppies, and mac and cheese.  My other friend does not eat pork. She ordered the barbequed chicken, with onions, hushpuppies, coleslaw, and veggies.  I also got a Diet Coke. You get unlimited refills. I got three drinks in total and got down to 2.5 glasses.  As far as barbeque goes, this place is amazing! The smoked sausage has cheese with some kick to it. It was awesome! The ribs fell off the bone and were so flavourful. My friend and I were nodding in agreement that they were the best ribs that we have ever had. The beef brisket was equally as tender and flavourful.   My friend knew that I have a weakness for mac and cheese. I got more of it. She was so generous. It was perfect.  Before coming to North Carolina, I was doing research on what foods are local to the state. I didn't get much information on it. I learned far more at this restaurant. It offers two types of barbeque sauce: a tomato-based one and a Carolina vinegar-based one. I loved the latter more. It was delicious.  This place also serves hushpuppies. They are deep-fried cornmeal goodness that is a Carolina thing. It tends to accompany barbeque. As a cornmeal lover, the huspuppies were so good and highly addictive!  Even though we were all pretty stuffed, we kicked it up a notch on the food coma scale and shared the chocolate cake. It was incredible! The crunchy chocolate crumble on top was unexpected and worked nicely with the moist, rich chocolate cake. Such a wonderful surprise!  Our server was wonderful. He moved to the States from Spain and was wonderful to chat with. He was attentive to our needs. This place is lucky to have him as an employee.  If you want delicious barbeque with great service, come here. You will not be disappointed.  (133)

Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chocolate cake - so good!
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Diet Coke

hHxtJVQykVo9iHWh7quPiQ.text: I love Midwood!! My husband and I had our first date there and we frequently go back! We've probably had just about everything on the menu. The beef rib is a personal favorite of mine! The service is always amazing! This is one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte

BghZLYbfe-bXqohpY0G5zA.text: I am giving it one less star not because they aren't great but because I've been spoiled on another BBQ restaurant called Wood Ranch BBQ.   Let's start with the 'Q', it's excellent. Fall off the bone and really flavorful. They also have a ton of side and other meals like burgers and salads. All equally good and shouldn't be ignored.   The bar service and drinks are always good.

bYJrnpFfs8JE0GqYMmTmTg.text: I came in here with some rolling papers and a lighter but quickly found out it was NOT that kind of smokehouse. After I got over my brief disappointment I discovered it was my second favorite kind of smokehouse... the barbecue kind!   The set up is really nice and spacious. We went for lunch and were sat immediately and got our food pretty quickly. We tried these bacon wrapped stuff jalapeno peppers that were to die for.   Midwood believes that those who stay ready don't have to get ready. They keep the BBQ sauces on deck on each table and they have wet naps on hand. You'd be surprised how many restaurants serve sticky food items and no wet naps.   The manager came over and checked on our table a couple of time as well. That was pretty dope. Not the kind of dope I expected in a place called Smokehouse but still dope. At least it wasn't named Midwood Traphouse. Although I guess they do move a lot of birds.   While we're here... Lebron James should win the NBA MVP every single year he's in the league. I mean what else does this guy have to do. I think he could take a pick up team from the local YMCA to the NBA finals. We really don't appreciate the greats while they are playing.   He never gets injured, he is an outspoken social critic and he doesn't cheat on his wife. We can't say that about Jordan, Kobe or anyone else you'd consider to be the king of the NBA.  The biggest knock on him is that he moved from Cleveland to Miami when he was 20 something years old. Yeah like YOU wouldn't do that if you could. It's time for people to let the Lebron James hate go and give him his flowers while he can still smell him.

iSrWqfGzTwVYx-QhsQOGgQ.text: Grabbed lunch here and it was pretty good.  Their salad was just okay.  Though their pulled pork was tasty, and cooked to perfection.    The service was outstanding, drinks constantly filled, the servers were attentive but not annoying.  Plenty of seating inside, and a nice restaurant overall.  It felt pretty pricey for what you were getting, and not sure it was justified, though still enjoyed the meal.  Easy parking outside, though not easy to find behind the main shopping center.

cUDW-bIAPTAFH5_ArEflAw.text: First time to this location! I usually stay in my hood at the original in plaza. My experience here was good though!   Seated quickly. Waiter came over quickly. Ordered, food came out quickly. Bathrooms were clean and smelled good. Restaurant looked clean, friendly employees. Food tasted good! Came out hot and fresh. All good things.   Personally tried new drinks this time: the Smokey-Rita $10 don't recommend, just not as good as it sounds. The R&R $11 whiskey rye, small glass, also don't recommend,  nothing special. I'd just stick with the beers
