dKoQfG6mSLI5askCQizR5A.text: I ordered the 4 meat combo with brisket, pulled pork, chicken and ribs. Chicken was dry...i believe it was breastmeat. That vinegar sauce they gave for it just made it worse. The pork was dry as well, def needed the sauce. Brisket was great. Def ask for the leaner parts instead of the fatty...my mistake and a learning experience. Ribs were great!  The macaroni and the greens were not tasty at all. Baked beans were good and hush puppies were addictive. Great selection on burbons and whiskey. Service was superb. I would come again but would avoid the things I mentioned.

YFVg8C_bO0N2NNRSIZZfBg.text: I asked the locals where the best barbecue in Charlotte was and some said definitely Midwood Smokehouse.  Well I was looking for barbecue that was unique to the area and this place was Texas style barbecue.  Well I am from Texas and know what Texas barbecue tastes like, this choice was a disappointment because I can have Texas barbecue back home.  Another disappointment was the fact that the brisket that I ordered, really lacked seasoning or a smoke flavor.  I've just had better Texas barbecue back in Texas.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Meh...I&#39;ve had better

E_vE05SoeBW75lMyOn85FA.text: We came to this location a month or so ago because we normally go to the Ballantyne location, but they were still setting up their patio.  We called to reserve a spot since it was nice outside and we had our dog with us.  We were hungry after a day hiking in the mountains so we wanted order a number of appetizers and then also the platter, which we more than likely knew we would take home for leftovers.  We first ordered the fries with pimento cheese, wings, and cornbread (special for that day).  We only received the pimento cheese and cornbread.  We thought the wings would just come with the meal, but they never came.  So either the server wasn't paying attention or just forgot to put them in with the order, and we didn't question her since we had more than enough food, but we would have loved to have tried them since we have actually not had Midwood's wings as much as we've been to multiple locations.  The fries were average to me, would have preferred a thicker fry, then it probably would have been excellent - would be willing to try it with pulled pork next time!  Cornbread was awesome and also made awesome leftovers!  They need to make this a permanent item on the menu.  The platter is normally what we order - we got it with pulled pork, brisket, ribs, and chicken, along with mac and cheese and veggies.  We normally get it with sausage instead of the pulled chicken, but for some reason I wanted to go with the chicken.  Now I understand why I avoid the chicken, it's not that great, it is chewy and just doused in mustard.  Just not my thing.  Pulled pork is the best, brisket is great, as are the ribs.  You know it is great bbq when you don't need to add sauce.  Fantastic meats as is.  Mac and cheese and veggies were good as usual.  Sometimes we get the bacon jalapenos as a side too.  All make for great leftovers as well.  Midwood is by far my favorite bbq place in the Charlotte area.  Food is usually great, but service is always a hit or miss at each location.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Platter with ribs, brisket, pork and chicken.  Get the sausage instead of chicken.
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cornbread and pimento cheese fries

6xSDsyZJhNZijUsX8947wQ.text: This was love at first bite.   On a recent trip to the (Southern) Queen City, we stopped in Midwood Smokehouse on a recommendation from an acquaintance that previously recommended a national chain restaurant for "local" taste and flavor. I was giving Midwood a shot because I researched on Yelp prior to getting into the car and then being disappointed.   The smells made my mouth water as I sat there going over the menu. I was happy to get some local beers, but from what I recall, the menu only lists the breweries (not the actual beer) and the taps rotate from time to time. That's ok, I ended up with a good one.   I ordered brisket and pulled pork. For my sides, I went with baked beans and Mac and cheese. The combo platter also came with hush puppies.   Everything was absolutely delicious and I moaned almost each time I took a bite. The meat was tender, full of flavor and I could've eaten this every day of my life. It was amazing. I believe the baked beans I had were probably the best damn baked beans I've ever had. The only thing I wasn't crazy about was the Mac and cheese, but it wasn't horrible, just not good enough to take room in my tummy with all the other goodness going on.   I highly recommend this place for lunch or dinner, or maybe even for a drink and snack after work. I'm happy to say that I'm Full Wood for Midwood!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Combo Platters

SP5gNIRuL6U63kOD4BfncQ.text: I know it's a chain, but I have yet to find better barbeque in the area. Between all the locations I've been to, the food is consistently good, and this location is no different! I got a small plate of Carolina pork with a side of bacon wrapped jalepenos and for under $10 was stuffed! The jalepenos do not have cream cheese in them (which I prefer) and aren't super spicy. I doused everything in the Midwood Signature sauce, not because it needed it but because that sauce is literal magic. The food looked so delicious and smelled so good that I completely forgot to take pictures!

ktD2B1IOBYnQFbJizeUrbw.text: We ended up getting seated in the dining area on the right back. Pretty spacious and lots of tables. The only annoying thing was that you were a few steps down and I could see waiters/waitresses passing by and they kept peeping down at our dining area, very distracting given that I was sitting at the table right below them.   It took awhile for our anyone to come over to greet us which was also annoying but once she got there she apologized and we didn't really have a problem with her service afterwards.   The massive rib, if it's available, is a MUST try! It is sooo tender and flavorful (the inside of the rib can be a little salty), you can cut it with a butter knife. THAT's how good it is! I'm salivating just thinking about it.   The smoked wings had a good smoke flavor but to be honest, it was a little dry. I've had better. So basically my 4 stars is on the ribs and their sides! I can't wait to go back and try other BBQ items on their menu.

Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked wings (10 pcs) with ranch or blue cheese

JtrZ-182IhEOZUJKFcff6Q.text: We made reservations while we were at a Charlotte Checkers game. Technically another location was closer, but yelp was showing a 45 minute wait for that one so I grabbed a time at this location.  It didn't take us as long to get here as we thought it would so we still had awhile to go before our actually time and waited a bit - understandably so because it was packed!  Our service was awesome. She was so nice and on top of it.  Food was good and the prices were reasonable. I'm not a huge BBQ fan, but the group I was with really enjoyed their meals. I ordered a salad and it was also delicious, but it didn't have much of a BBQ feel since I'm not a huge fan. Friends ordered platters. There was so much food! We were stuffed so dessert didn't happen.

-Vpj0Nlh_6exD5Zd3P0kmA.text: One of the best places to eat in Charlotte! My boyfriend and I absolutely love it here. We're never disappointed! The food is incredible, atmosphere is awesome, and the staff is always wonderful! We recently went to celebrate a birthday and Jennifer was our waitress. She was amazing!!! She was polite, kind, friendly, and funny! We're always looking forward to the next time we eat here!

bQvbq9yEQsU7tn2YMuVqTg.text: Nom! Nom! Nom! I love BBQ and this place does it justice. The service was okay, and we accommodated for six people rather quickly, especially on a busy day. The food was delicious the BBQ Pork sandwich was so yummy and I highly recommend it, my only issue was that it was too salty. I eventually just took it off the bun and ate it. The wings, were like out of this world though, and super unique, so crunchyyyy, but came oddly late after everything else was done so we were too full to eat them. I highly recommend the Mac and Cheese but not the collard greens (which are some of my favorite veggies), I wasn't expecting them to be spicy. Anywho it's a place to try, just prepare for a wait :)

vymd9seDJwsiYCvgm0AADg.text: Bbq excellent meats! I had the smoked salmon salad which was delicious and enormous! The salmon filet was yummy and the salad of spring greens was tasty. They had chopped vegetables, cucumbers, tomatoes and chick peas too. My hubby had the fatty brisket and the smoked vegetables side. He enjoys their brisket immensely!!  They are located behind park rd shopping center and sharing parking with other businesses so get there early, or do takeout like we did.

eohBn2XzrqjF0caPS-pTTg.text: Midwood Smokehouse has several locations around Charlotte and its surrounding areas.  This one is in the Park Road Shopping area and is quite busy.  The parking is plentiful, as it is located behind the main shopping area.  There are a few handicapped spaces up front.  When we visited, near lunch time, we had to wait a few moments to be seated.  We were quickly served when we were seated in a nice spacious booth near the front windows.  Our waitress was busy, but still attentive.  The food was a disappointment for me, as I'd been to the one on Central and had such a great experience.  We ordered the queso dip which was merely Velveeta heated with Rotel and served with chips (stale!) from a bag.    I have to tell you, if you have a non-barbecue lover in your party, this is not the place for you.  I thought for sure there would be some options for my barbecue hater, but I was wrong.  Luckily, I found chicken tenders as a salad topper and asked could we have an order of those.  We were kindly accommodated.  My son got the smoked beef brisket with a side of macaroni and cheese.  He loved it all, and the meat was perfectly smoked.  I thought the macaroni portion looked a little skimpy, but the flavor was good.  I got the smoked chicken salad and it was just too much.  The balance of actual lettuce to salad toppings was very off, with each mouthful consisting of mostly corn and black beans.  I would definitely not get that again, and left most of it uneaten.  Honestly, I doubt we'll be back, but full disclosure: I am NOT a barbecue fan.  This was my son's choice for his birthday :)  The barbecue lover did love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Tenders with fries.  Not on the menu, but gratefully accommodated.
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked Chicken Salad.  Not my favorite
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked Beef Brisket with macaroni and cheese, pickled onions and hushpuppies

CuyiPs-n42kQKIqEN8S_Lg.text: This place is great! I walked in and sat at the bar to place a to go order. The bartender was so welcoming and patient. I can be a bit (lot) indecisive. He was also easy on the eyes and a southern charmer/flirt. I settled on the brisket  (fatty of course) and the house made jalapeno pepper sausage. The food arrived quickly. The bartender explained the four different types of sauces to me (i.e. house, vinegar-based, mustard-based). He said he wasn't a fan of the mustard sauce (I appreciate honesty) but it compliments the sausage well.   The food: the brisket was great. Not too fatty, and seasoned well. The sausage was spicy but good. As the bartender stated, the mustard sauce a a perfect compliment for the sausage. Two of the three remaining sausages were also tasty. There was one I didn't care for at all. The greens were good. Mac and cheese was not grandma's but a good try. They also offer ginger beer. Thanks to all you Moscow mule drinkers out there, a non drinker like myself can finally find ginger beer widely available! Overall, I would definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

VrjLGeR0GzS0VqoUwTge_w.text: Outstanding! We ordered a variety of food and ate family style since we had a large group. My favorites were the burnt ends, brisket and the jalapeno corn bread. Service was excellent and they had interesting drink options as well.  We ate very well here. I will return next time i am in Charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

ghlc_K9_IJWymrqSzQqTZw.text: Midwood smokehouse is a solid spot for good barbecue. It's spacious, well laid out, a variety of types of seating, and has quick service. Everything I've had there has been good, but I especially like the burnt ends. have that great combination of crispy and fatty and meaty and juicy. The sides and appetizers are generally right tasty,  especially the bacon wrapped jalapenos. The place is solid. I think you'll like the it if you give it try.

tAV9lxk09MgIwcVKiqx6tg.text: Back from NYC and parts north, left the airport and came here for more normaller food at way reasonabler prices. Started with smokey smokey wings and blue cheese dressing. Crispy meaty chicken bits on an iron platter are a fine 'Howdy do!' followed by tacos and more chicken... $13 taco trio comes with cornslaw and choice of side: el fuego was a nice take on the classic chicken-bacon-ranch taco; stockyard does tex-mex right with brisket, avocado, and pico; red neck brings zippy redsalsa and pulled pork together deliciously. And mac & cheese... Crisped outside, tender smoked 1/2-chicken plus sweet potato fries, smoked veggies, and hush puppies. Wing and leg are good for now, breast and thigh will become someone's lunch. Finished with a small banana pudding as the rain started...

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. banaña pudding
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. chicken, fries, veggies, hush puppies?
Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. redneck, stockyard, el fuego, mac, cheese, slaw...

k-gNFE12Ba4YsSIngIy2EA.text: I went to Midwood on a recent trip to North Carolina. We had a large group and we ordered 2 pig outs, drinks, bacon wrapped jalapeno poppers and dessert (banana bread pudding and pecan pie). For the pig outs, we tried all the different types of meat: pulled pork, smoked chicken, sausage, ribs, and brisket with mac and cheese, coleslaw and corn bread. Everything was delicious but the highlight had to be the brisket, corn bread and sauces. The brisket was so tender and flavorful! Our waitress was very nice and we even got a semi-private room on the side. If you're looking for NC bbq, you can't go wrong with Midwood! The prices were also very reasonable and the portions were generous.

fcwN3f7ofgCgsYTir3NI1w.text: Awesome brisket! Surprisingly I also found them to have the best smoked salmon in town. The bourbon selection is as good as any in town. Friendly, professional staff. All round great place to eat!

z4ef8CqsigDtZwv3gB1uOQ.text: Had an excellent salad with brisket in top. The small is more than enough and the staff is very attentive. I don't love barbecue but this was excellent.

Sl_1CfDwFzGWPAmqNxjorA.text: Midwood never disappointed me on central avenue and I'm happy to say this location won't either!  Everything about midwood is exactly how I would explain NC BBQ. Their brisket is perfect with the option of fatty,lean, or a mixed portion. Their bbq is perfect eastern style vinegar based even with the delicious sauces they offer. The burnt ends, the ribs, the chicken; it's hard to choose just one item here! (Go with the "well fed" or "pig out" for a great sampling) However don't let the yummy plates steer you away from the sandwiches. My favorite is the Texas style brisket sandwich! Get it with pimento cheese and you'll be sure to leave extremely full and satisfied.  As far as side the bbq backed beans are my favorite. This aren't some bushes baked beans heated up and served to you, these beans are packed with flavor and pieces of meat that really deserve its own special name ...midwood's special beans! The Mac and cheese is also a favorite made home style and perfect!  They offer a good drink selection and the atmosphere is good here. Less crowded than the central location but still just as popular. This is by far my favorite place to bring out of town guess looking for great NC food!

GUK5xixD7rXfbGpPIwUW3Q.text: Visiting from Maryland and this place is definitely one of the best restaurants in Charlotte! Great food, great atmosphere and great service! Stephanie was our waitress both times and she was awesome. She was extremely patient with us as we couldn't decide  on what to order. She answered all of our questions and even allowed us to sample some of the menu items to help us decide.

nRiTT5OUYLslm-Ys5HjqXw.text: New favorite place, affordable and absolutely delicious ! I had the 1930 cheesesteak i believe it was called and it was truly amazing. I will definitely be coming back and i will definitely tell my friends about it. Our server (Bryan) was kind, checked on us and took very good care of us.

_K18hcQ5K1gxF_8h-4Bl2g.text: Holy amazing. The Mac and cheese is rightfully put on Top lists. Does not disappoint. Burnt ends are unreal. Great coleslaw and hush puppies. Cool vibe with wine and craft beer. I can't believe it's taken me so long to get to. I'll be craving this from now on.

kXiH9LWvIFwmXqjyzOfOIQ.text: Had a corporate dinner here, the Brisket was as good as I've ever has. The baked beans had meat in them and they were wonderful. Great beer selection.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

U-HNJa8q9BYUBmCEwuyUPg.text: We are very happy that Midwood decided to make our neighborhood their next home.  Food was excellent as always, but the service was even better.  We were blessed with Jocelyn (unsure of spelling) and she was impressive, super attentive, friendly, and warm.  The manager checked in on all the tables and we gave him great feedback.  I had the chopped pork, my husband had the ribs, and our son had the chicken tenders; no complaints, everything was great.  We did start with the BBQ queso with brisket and it was average at best, not a do-over.  The banana pudding was also not a do-over, all whipped cream and no pudding.  Overall, an excellent place for dinner and we'll be back!!

yfzO0CW2iM2yGtqyL89ydQ.text: First time we ate here food and service was great. Second time service was still great but meat was overwhelmingly smokey as if the had changed the wood they are using or that liquid smoke or some other smoke flavor had been added losing the taste of the actual meat.  We will certainly try it again but would love to see better consistency in flavor and smokiness. I know it is tricky but you guys do it for a living!

Vmhsu8zMwO_pJojTUS9i2A.text: Just opened but great food as always at Midwood. Nice atmosphere and very attentive wait staff. Lots of parking as they are "behind" Blackhawk Hardware. Do give them a try. You will enjoy I'm sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burnt Ends with hush puppies and sweet potato fries.

lQMnwuUYDVGXARPmfAuv6g.text: Let me start by saying that we normally love this place. The food is awesome and the service is generally good as well. We live in Chantilly and eat here often and have never had a bad experience until this week. That's why I'm not giving one star, which is what I feel like doing.   On Wednesday, my husband took our kids to eat. I was going to come from work to meet them. My husband texted me right after they got there that I might want to rethink meeting them because the server seemed very impaired ("like she's doing drugs in the bathroom" were his exact words) and didn't seem like she even heard his order. What followed next was just crazy. She came twice more to ask what they ordered, when she brought the drinks she had to open the kids' drinks at the table and look inside (I have TWO kids, two drinks only) to see which was the water and which was the milk, and when the food finally came out almost an hour later, 3 out of 4 orders were completely wrong. Another server came over and asked if everything was ok. My husband explained to him that everyone's food was wrong- like really wrong and that he had already put in his order 3 times. The other server got a manager who took the order again. The right food did finally come out. When the original server brought the check, we put our card in and she ran it and brought it back. My husband signed it, and then she came over AGAIN and said, "I'll run this for you and be right back." My husband then said, "you just ran it a minute ago, thanks" and left.   Nothing comped off the check.

b-m1tzkeN8OAO2q-kWwgTw.text: I had their cheesesteak and it was made with brisket, carmelized onion, and white American cheese on a homemade roll. It was the BEST I've ever had! The sweet potato fries were great too! Just yummmm.

V0vVonF33B2UWwwMoQPRyw.text: Great food. The cheese fries app was very good and so was the brisket. Get the sausage as an add, very flavorful. I'm not a fan of mustard based sauce but theirs was really good.

YiAKzSl5fOuvIXsu2HkhLg.text: The address is actually 540 Brandywine Road.    Great service, great food, great atmosphere. We sat in the round booth right in the center of all the energy.  Started with the smoked wings. Very tender and tasty. Main course was the hickory salmon with a pico salsa. Again very delicious.  Earlier in the week we had the pecan cobbler with ice cream.  Decedent and delicious.  Highly recommend

KwPZ9xKT7toPvZjyO7q9GQ.text: My friends and I were in town to attend the Carolina Panthers verses the New Orleans Saints game.  When we asked for a good place to get some BBQ, this place was recommended.  The service was excellent and our food was delicious.  Our only complaint was that it was un comfortably cold, but the manager graciously adjusted the temperature.

aOnQGWtq1bLIyUOJKNw8hQ.text: I think my Ribs and BBQ beans deserved a 4 and a half. Service a Four. The ribs were moist and tender and had a great flavor. The beans were just full of character and enjoyable to eat. My Chicken and Mac and cheese deserve a 3 !  Let me explain why: the chicken breast was like rubber to cut and chew! The manager did inquire and offer another piece (which is why I am giving a 4 star instead of three) I declined as I had eaten most of it, just disappointed . The Mac and cheese had no soul! It was cold and bland, like it had been sitting in a giant pan waiting to end its life :)  Love having this place in the hood and will walk over again and try other dishes. Warning they are new and run out of Ribs early so go early and order right away :)

bPH1Ab6lPJXob_zYD4ZtNw.text: This place is the real deal as far as BBQ. I usually get the brisket because it is so good. It is tender and moist with an excellent smoke ring and amazing flavor. The pork is also very good and the sides are excellent. Good mac n cheese and I love the jalapeno poppers. To add to this I have only had it as take out because it is close to my wife's work. I am going to try to eat at the restaurant soon and update my review. I can only imagine it is better at the actual restaurant.

dfRwNn87gPYGHwLfS-tgeA.text: I came here with a group of friends who are not natives to NC. We enjoyed the platter, chicken, wings, and all other sorts of barbeque. Second only to the great food was our service from our waitress Haja. She was personable, friendly, and did an outstanding job. Would absolutely come back.

3F3U0kAbqi6toMTvzktOCA.text: Excellent bbq especially the brisket burnt ends and don't forget the pecan cobbler.  Food and service were great.  A very good dinner

QHCbmn67nh5ZNRQ93mDUPg.text: Went for a late lunch with a group that ordered a variety of food.  Everyone enjoyed their meals.  The chopped salad with brisket had a nice variety of fresh greens, but they were a little stingy with the brisket.  Other folks had the brisket either on a platter or in a sandwich.  The brisket was tender, had nice flavor and minimal fat.  I'd definitely recommend saving room for the banana pudding.

Y8WUfPKfZz1Xn0eKQtQCxQ.text: Very disappointed.. made reservations through Leslie Giordon early in the week for 11/10/18 at 7pm. This was a company dinner I was organizing. I made Leslie aware that I had a very large group (25+) who in turn, made the General Manager Richard Chrestin aware. She informed me that they wouldn't be able to seat the group all at one table, but could have us at a few tables in the same area together. That worked for us and I told Leslie let's book it. She confirmed and I coordinated with my crew to meet there.. I arrive early to let them know I was there and everyone would be pulling up. The host, non friendly and quite sure of himself, told me he had nothing on the list.. I pulled my back and forth with Leslie up for him and confirmed I had the right location in case I screwed up -- right place. I show where Richard was made aware in the messages. They go get him. When he gets to me, he confirms he was aware of my group, but told Leslie they couldn't do it.. I show him all of our messages and what we worked out and he says he doesn't know why she said that..  He wasn't slightly apologetic and lackluster with concern. He said he can scatter us around and we'd have to wait for each table and however many they could seat at that time.. so, his proposal was for us to have our company dinner in batches.. I just walked out to an equally disappointed group.. we had to now try and find somewhere else to go.. Food is always good at Midwood, but don't try to reserve a large group outing here. Take you $1000+ elsewhere.

DuufgXB1BfRaalPmbVnb3Q.text: Place was great, classy, and Mac and cheese was on point. Brisket is what you should obviously get

U-Nh06xv82B68joPAuVqsg.text: Colby cheese is the bomb. Best server ever. 10/5 would visit again, just for him! colby is GRATE. Is the goat.

Gfk51NLPMjoclJge1sUb6g.text: My husband and I drove a ways to get here but, we'll worth the drive. Never had better brisket. Fantastic. Great service also. We'll be back.

75I5OVdYVcdOtDBGt5qBWA.text: Fabulous service, food and staff. It's a fun place with great music. The burnt ends and salmon are my favorites. Great salads too!  The best part is the banana pudding for dessert!  Yummmmm! Will visit often.

9uLwxK9kIcdEqJ9MszxRHg.text: First off I love the food here and the wait staff is excellent.   I went with my dog as many people do.  We were the first ones on the patio and enjoyed our time.  Other people (and dogs) came and went, with no problems at all.  In fact the wait staff was so kind to my dog.  Then I think he was a manager because he didn't look like the waiters sat a family behind me. Apparently my dog who was on a leash and tied to my table got in his way (because She's friendly) he told me to reign in my dog or he would ask us to leave.  I have never been threatened with being kicked out of a restaurant before and we were not bothering anybody so I will never return to that restaurant again.  I hope he doesn't treat any other dog owners the way he treated me.

TKz5-re65aV5rX5mHH29hQ.text: This is the best restaurant I've been to in charlotte. I kept seeing really high reviews and knew it had to be a stop for my weekend visit. I'm a HUGE Mac and Cheese fan (who isn't?) and it's the best I've had in my life. The grilled cheese with brisket is top notch! Great waiter and staff. The owner came by and talked to us & was a great guy. When I move her in July it will be a go-to. Thank you, Midwood Smokehouse!!

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

TtcW24Kyxqg7xUc12pcAXQ.text: Some of the better bbq in Charlotte! If I had to be picky I would want just a little more smoky taste to the pulled pork. Mac and cheese is alright, crinkle fries and hush puppies are good too.

C2FblUeik9cEDO278zlsMA.text: So being from out of town, I told myself that I definitely had to get BBQ before I left. Unfortunately, when you're participating in a wedding and staying about 35 minutes from the venue, time runs a bit short. Found this place on Yelp, and we were a little skeptical since it was out in the burbs, but being that we were so short on time, we figured burbs BBQ was better than nothing. Upon first walking in, it was a nice sized space, clean, and pretty modern in terms of decor. My first thought was, well, guess I'm at a chain. Boy could I not have been more wrong. We were seated quickly, and the service was fantastic. The server gave us a rundown on the history and the well known dishes (i.e. the brisket). We got a combination platter of ribs, burnt tips, brisket, and pulled pork. Sides of mac and cheese, beans, and greens. In terms of the sauces, they had a standard BBQ, Carolina vinegar based sauce, a Carolina mustard, and a habanero BBQ.   The brisket was all it was cracked up to be. There was a nice pink ring from the smoking. There was a nice juiciness to it from the fat. Great smoke flavor that did not need sauce at all. Adding the vinegar sauce to the pulled pork definitely enhanced its flavor. The pork was already so tender. The burnt ends though, wow. So tender, smoky, and filled with flavor. The ribs had a nice dry rub to them and were fall off the bone tender. The greens were tender but not completely fall apart, perfect for my liking. Mac and cheese wasn't mind blowing but good. The beans had some chunks of pork in them that enhanced the flavor. I was completely wrong with my assumptions. I would definitely visit again if down in Charlotte.

Bvnln2o3-_0nvPwwvAx5Ow.text: Been before and had pretty good service, but this time service was painfully slow. I assume they did not expect the steady traffic of soccer lovers and only staffed with two servers for a Monday lunch. One of the two servers was also tending to the bar. Poor girl was all over the place.  We observed what looked like the manager also assisting in the kitchen. We were ready to leave prior to the bartender/server finally taking our order. Luckily the food came quickly, but this will allow pause for future visits. We normally do not have weekday leisure lunches. Too many cheaper and quicker fast-casual options.

HFk-1OdOC3vPZgEUxf98vw.text: If you are looking for barbeque in Charlotte, is will Get It Done.  Great brisket that comes out fast. Friendly staff. Great place.

-4s5Y3M7SsqVlDRCZqXW8A.text: This was disappointing!  The burnt ends were very dry and the award wining Mac and cheese had very little flavor and look old.  If I did not order to go the burnt ends would have been sent back and so would the Mac & cheese.  The moist brisket appeared to be pre sliced.  The food might be ok but the rating on Yelp is over rated.

NK2i97W7qzzvHOAmM3rbKQ.text: We went after it had been open for about a month. As a reference the location in Plaza Midwood is my hands down favorite BBQ spot in Charlotte. I think this place is close but not the same. For some reason I thought flavor, moisture, etc of the pork BBQ and ribs were not the same as the original location.  Service was super efficient and friendly, I loved the beers on tap and drank many of them. The food was kind of just luke warm when we got it, but I definitely want to try again and see how they are doing now that they've been up and running for awhile. If they can replicate the entire Plaza Midwood location experience this close to my house I will have a belly full of BBQ way too often!

uE4R3e5h4aqm4gxJGGHvKA.text: Enjoyed salad here on a Saturday afternoon. Consistent and delicious. Great service with a responsible manager. Kid friendly, family friendly, small bar, friendly for a quick solo lunch, too. Always busy. Everything I've tried here is definitely up to par. Putting this restaurant on my favorite list.

oXmVszH4uN474i-qdXrNlQ.text: Enjoyed the wings.  The collards greens are primo.  The baked beans are uniquely tasty.  But the desserts is why I return.  The banana pudding had the perfect ratio of  bananas to pudding to vanilla wafers.   Today I ordered the pecan pie to go but hadn't tasted it yet

pwPMWpP-9eJjOoyagdqF6Q.text: I had a great meal and experience at Midwood--the food was tasty and came out quickly, the service was great, and the beer list was excellent. We had the bacon wrapped jalapenos, burnt ends plate with collard greens, and the special burger (brisket & chuck patty topped with pulled pork and onion straws). Everything we had was great, cooked as ordered, fresh and flavorful. They had a great special on 20 oz draft beers and a well-curated list of local and national beers. I'll definitely be back!

Ao0Ek_jIzP-nvAJoV6EWIg.text: We got the "sampler platter" so we could try everything! It was all delicious-ribs, chopped BBQ, burnt ends, and brisket. Service was speedy and friendly. We'll definitely be back!!

V5Pa7oq_STIijz5hLCLGnA.text: while in Charlotte on our way to Florida we look for a restaurant and found this wonderful Midwood barbeque bar and smokehouse. excellent service wonderful atmosphere and delicious barbeque food we found it on yelp and I recommend it highly . We ordered the combo platter Beef Brisket,Pulled Chicken, Ribs delicious , be sure to say hi to manager Chris and the best server Erica  from the Canadian Collingwood Couple.

photos.caption: Photo of Midwood Smokehouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

CjtlP8f9ulKVFI4awoE_Ig.text: We called ahead of time and got our names put on the waitlist. Very popular restaurant so call ahead! Our first time here and it was delicious. My boyfriend for the Carolina pork and loved the vinegar on it. I got the chicken bbq (it's pulled) and it was so fresh and delicious too! We finished with their banana bread pudding and it was so yummy! Everything about this place was awesome.

1u64TfBiTVV_C3sGO8sW0w.text: As a certified Kansas City Barbeque Judge in the North East, I find I get weary of the molasses, maple, and tomato and brown sugar based sauces. Midwood does it right, and does it Carolina style. Mustard sauces and vinegars, all kept in a warming tray so they are served hot. Their enormous rotating smoker in the back can handle to quantities that they have to produce for how good their 'q' is. The pork is soft and pulls easily without being baby food. The brisket (the most difficult of BBQ meats) is juicy, smoky, and flavorful. The brightly colored wood interior of the dining room is festooned with old timey comic book and movie paraphernalia. Along with a welcoming staff, you cannot go wrong here.

21mBmFQLub3J-jaXCAFfRw.text: I usually would rate this place as 5 stars but I ordered a burger for take out and usually they are very good but this time it was dry and burnt with no condiments when I order it medium. Come on guys....

zwmyGLBmTDfYWrmZFQiDdw.text: Extremely disappointing.  We picked up our take order of ribs and wings at 5:45 p.m. Both items were completely dried out. They obviously had been cooked hours ago. No excuse to give customers food that should have been removed and scraped. Clearly they have no quality control or management just doesn't care.  We have had food before and it was fine. Suggest you look at your food before driving away. The manager obviously does not look or care.
